psychologytoday.com/2015/05/4-character-.title: 4 Character Strengths Sustain U2's Success Psychology Today...
psychologytoday.com/2015/05/4-character-.snippet: How does U2 reflect a connection culture? One reason is the band's many character strengths that they express and appreciate in one another, such as love, humility, and appreciation of beauty and excellence.

psychologytoday.com/2015/05/junk-food-gu.title: Junk Food, Gut, and Brain Psychology Today...
psychologytoday.com/2015/05/junk-food-gu.snippet: People who eat mostly whole foods, meaning minimally processed foods that don't need a label to tell you what is in it, tend to have better mental health. Why is that the case? It could be due to how these foods affect the gut.

psychologytoday.com/2015/05/there-s-a-hi.snippet: The hidden secret among many entrepreneurs is the psychological price they pay for their choices. The demands of business ownership may place entrepreneurs at a higher risk of specific mental health problems.

varma-vedantham.blogspot.com/2015/04/wha.snippet: Ch-1. The Knowledge Situation. Part-15. We may wrongly imagine, oftentimes, that we live one kind of life and the world is getting on in another way altogether. For instance, these days we have a total bifurcation of physics and psychology.
